BR_text.BRsummary: Wrong language code for the Serbian language
BR_text.BRdescription:
Hi, I'm wondering that shouldn't the language code for Serbian be  rather than  (according to <denchmark-link:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes>ISO 639-1</denchmark-link>
 )?
 And since Serbian uses either the <denchmark-link:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbian_Cyrillic_alphabet>Cyrillic alphabet</denchmark-link>
  or the <denchmark-link:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaj%27s_Latin_alphabet>Latin alphabet</denchmark-link>
 , is there any need to distinguish between the two writing systems (e.g. sr-Cyrl for Serbian Cyrillic and sr-Latn for Serbian Latin according to <denchmark-link:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_15924>ISO 15924</denchmark-link>
 ) in spaCy to make things more clear (the newly-added stop words for Serbian in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/4078>#4078</denchmark-link>
  uses the Cyrillic alphabet)?
 Similar issues: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/2339>#2339</denchmark-link>
  (Norwegian Bokmål and Norwegian Nynorsk), <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/discussions/1308>#1308</denchmark-link>
 , Simplified Chinese and Tradition Chinese
 
 Operating System: Windows 10 64-bit
 Python Version Used: 3.7.4
 spaCy Version Used: 2.1.8

comments_0.comment_text:
Hm, I think you're right, it should be "sr" (in fact <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ines>@ines</denchmark-link>
  got it right with the issue labels!)

comments_2.comment_text:
I agree that it should be , I was using the usual abbreviation for <denchmark-link:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_codes_of_Serbia>republic of serbia</denchmark-link>
 . I will create new update asap.

comments_3.comment_text:
Thanks for fixing this so quickly with PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/4159>#4159</denchmark-link>
  !

comments_4.comment_text: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
